description: Numbers n such that 4*10^n + 3*R_n is prime, where R_n = 11...1 is the repunit (A002275) of length n.
comments: Also numbers n such that (13*10^n-1)/3 is prime.a(24) > 10^5. - _Robert Price_, Dec 21 2014
links: Makoto Kamada, Prime numbers of the form 433...33.
Index entries for primes involving repunits
example: 43 and 433 are prime, so 1 and 2 are terms of the sequence.
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 10 2000
